item.title: Notes
item.description: L1: Periodic Functions Notes What is a periodic function? A periodic function is a function in which the values of y repeat at regular intervals of θ.

item.title: L1 - Pascal's Triangle
item.description: Notes What is Pascal's Triangle? Pascal’s Triangle is a triangle formed by adding adjacent numbers from the previous rows to form the numbers below them ...

item.title: L2 - Binomial Theory
item.description: Notes Binomial Observations Coefficients: When a binomial is raised to a power, it’s coefficient corresponds to the values of a specific row. n=row (x+y)n Example (x+y)3=x3+3x2y+3xy2+y3 Coefficients=1,3,3,1 *Corresponds to 4th row of pascals triangle Exponents: When a binomial is raised to a power, it’s exponents approaches towards, or recedes away from n x→exponents decrease (n to 0) y→exponents increase (0 to n) Example (x+y)3=y0x3+3x2y1+3x1y2+x0y3 x exponents=0,1,2,3 y exponents=3,2,1,0 Binomial Theory (a+b)n=(0n​)an+(1n​)an−1b1+(2n​)an−2b2+...+(n−1n​)abn−1+(nn​)bn a diminishes from n to 0 b increases from 0 until it reaches n r increases from 0 until it reaches n There are n+1 terms in total The coefficient of a term is given by tn,r​ and n​Cr​ The sum of the exponents of a and b is the row n Questions Example 1 Tip Remember binomial theorem.

item.title: L3 - Arithmetic Sequences
item.description: Notes What is a sequence? A sequence is a list of numbers, figures, letters, etc. that are organized in a distinct and identifiable order Each number in a sequence is called a term.

item.title: L4 - Geometric Sequences
item.description: Notes What is a geometric sequence? A geometric sequence is a sequence in which the ratio between two consecutive terms is constant. We can always multiply/divide the same value to find the next term.

item.title: L6 - Recursive Sequences
item.description: Notes What is a Recursive Sequence? A Recursive Sequence is a sequence where the value of one term is based upon the previous terms of the sequence. Recursive Formula Formula that permits us to calculate a term, using the previous terms of the sequence Fibonacci Sequence The Fibonacci Sequence is a recursive sequence with the equation of: t1​=1 t2​=1 tn​=tn−1​+tn−2​ n≥3,n∈N In general there are 3 components to a recursive formula The beginning terms A formula Restrictions Restrictions n does not go below 1 For a lot of Recursive Sequences you will need restrictions.
